website_summaries.verdict: A good rescue-oriented strap cutter that can handle larger, tougher straps in industrial and emergency situations.
pros: Small knife design makes it easy to keep the knife tucked away in a pocket or bag when not in use
Handle is comfortable to hold due to the ergonomic curves
cons: Replacement blades are reportedly difficult to find and buy when needed

customer_reviews.title: I normally don't rate this high but this deserves it.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this since I realized that I didn't have a safe way to cut either seatbelts or clothing in a trauma situation so I ordered this.I actually had one in the past but somewhere through the time, I lost it or it was 'appropriated'. I didn't take much notice of it back then but now I realize I need it. I am glad to have this tool in my kit.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: A must for an ifak or edc
customer_reviews.text: Ideal to cut clothing, jeans and t-shirts to get a clear view of the wound, this is a must A bit hard to find replacement blades but not impossible. Nice pouch even do I didn’t use it it was on my ifak kit
customer_reviews.author: Romel

customer_reviews.title: Economical and effective
customer_reviews.text: The body of it or the handle as some would say is made of what looks to be a durable ABS plastic type material. Which is fine by me for the specified, limited uses this has and that also helps cut down on weight. The pouch is made of nice cordura sort of material with molle attachment backing.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B

customer_reviews.title: CIF takes them
customer_reviews.text: Turned it into CIF and they had no idea it wasn’t actually there’s.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Medic with me whipped one of these out and cuts clothes off like a hot knife through butter in one swoop
customer_reviews.text: I always carried trauma shears until one day the suckers didn't cut for anything. Medic with me whipped one of these out and cuts clothes off like a hot knife through butter in one swoop. Got me a pair immediately after that. Seem to hold up well against corrosion from blood.
customer_reviews.author: firefighter

customer_reviews.title: Great cutter
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these strap cutters for swift water work and tech diving. Great design with a full handle and finger groves, only bad side is getting replacement blades......very difficult to find. If you buy this cutter, it will do great, just hard to find replacement blades.
customer_reviews.author: NW Backpacker

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: I luckily have not had to use it, but it looks like it's well built. I am using it in SCUBA BC as an emergency line cutter in case I get wrapped up in excess line.
customer_reviews.author: Big W

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality & heavy duty sheath. Replaceable blades. A must have for every car & first responded. Cuts through seat belt material like it is warm butter.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: ... the first two years I was in the USMC amazing product, great feel and good dexterity
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first two years I was in the USMC amazing product, great feel and good dexterity, easily accessible but only complaint is that ive seen a couple break in between the two screws that hold the blade down.
customer_reviews.author: logan s.

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it's great, just not to cut apart cable looms
customer_reviews.text: I gor this to cut apart cable looms, which it will not do, but I'm sure it's great for its intended-use purpose.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaF

customer_reviews.title: Iff accepts
customer_reviews.text: Matches usmc issued all you need to know is iff will accept it
customer_reviews.author: Dmt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts plastic and banding off pallets like it was nothing. Puts my standard utility knife to shame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great strap cutter. Does require a lanyard to be made, not included.
customer_reviews.author: David Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Spare blades can be found on Amazon. The pouch has an inner pocket for the spare blades.
customer_reviews.author: Dan R.

customer_reviews.title: Top notch for what it was designed for.
customer_reviews.text: Our troops were issued these around the middle of 2010. Great tool, no doubt. Never during my enlistment did I possess an easier method with which to open those stubborn MRE pouches.. ...also good for seat belts.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

product_meta.title: Ontario 1431 Model 4 CB Strap Cutter Rescue Tool (Brown)
product_meta.description: 1431 Features: -Made of Titanium Nitride. -Made in the USA. -Plain edge blade: 0.38". Product Type: -Specialty. Quantity: -Set. Generic Dimensions: -Knife closed length: 3.84". -Knife open length: 6.5". -Product weight: 0.19 lb. Dimensions: Overall Product Weight: -0.19 Pounds.
